inn1.comm: good line first up, outside off, Smith takes a stride forward and defends to mid-off
this one nips back from outside off, Smith starts off to leave it then plays very late...half an appeal, but the ball didn't shape back enough
that would have been gone...Smith drops the ball into the off side and sprints off for a single, Bell runs in from cover but can't hit direct. Smith would have been gone by miles
on off stump, defended down to mid-off
angled into leg stump, takes the pad and bobbles behind the stumps...they decline a single after the earlier alarm
back of a length on off stump, defended on the top of the bounce into the covers
touch of extra bounce to Smith, takes a thick inside edge down to fine leg
opens the face and pushes square on the off side, finds the gap between point and cover...and fumble by Ian Bell allows them back for a second
beaten outside off by one which bounces outside off, Gibbs tries to force off the back foot
outside off, hint of shape away from Gibbs as he leaves alone
on middle and off, keeps Gibbs in defence as he can't free his arms, pushed into the leg side
nips back again, Gibbs jumps into line and is taken on the thigh pad...Broad runs through and collects the ball
moves right across the stumps and flicks it fine, the fielder at long leg is very wide but Luke Wright makes a lot of ground and brings out a full-length dive to save the boundary
edged off the back foot wide of second slip, runs way down to third man...Wright couldn't get near this one
on off stump, Gibbs plays this as though it kept low, but he was trapped on the back foot a little and jabs it out to square leg
opens the face and runs away to backward point, where the returning Paul Collingwood is in action
trademark Gibbs, a short-arm pull through square as Anderson drops short. It sat up and Gibbs had plenty of time to place it wide of the fielder
better line from Anderson, outside off and defended back down the pitch
back of a length, Smith is taken on the top of the leg...and he isn't happy about some movement behind the bowler
nudged into the leg side, a comfortable quick single this time but Smith doesn't look completely settled yet
nice carry outside off as Gibbs leaves this one through to Matt Prior
gone! first breakthrough for England, Gibbs advances down the pitch but Broad dragged his length back and it takes the inside through to Prior as Gibbs tries an ungainly swing
good start, nips back on off stump and Kallis works it down to fine leg
nice delivery, good carry outside off and Smith shoulders arms
full on middle, searching for the swing, Kallis meets it with a sweet on-drive straight to mid-on
good pace from Anderson, outside off and lifts through to Prior as Kallis doesn't offer a shot
driven firmly into the off side, didn't quite come off the middle
keeping it straight and full, punched firmly back to Anderson in his follow through...speed gun said that was 91mph
on off stump, defended square on the off side to point
great response from Kallis, dragged a touch short and wide, cracked away square through the covers
on off stump, defended into the covers
jumps into a defensive push, goes square on the off side to Collingwood at backward point
a good save from Collingwood at backward point as Smith defends on his toes
driven off a thick inside edge into the leg side
driven off the front foot, between mid-off and cover, not quite timed but races away over a quick outfield...that's Smith's best shot of the day

gone! brilliant catch from Prior, outside edge from Smith and Prior dives one handed in front of Owais Shah at first slip and snaffles a stunner. Sweet moment for Prior after all the talk about his keeping, there were no half measures in that effort.
squared up on off stump, Kallis defends with static footwork, the ball runs away to backward point
turned into the leg side, gap there at midwicket
full, searching for the yorker on middle stump, turned straight to midwicket
back of a length, defended back down the pitch
outside off, hint of swing, left alone...90mph
drifting onto leg stump, de Villiers misses out as he flicks it to midwicket again
well bowled, pace from Broad and it nipped back into Kallis who got himself into a bit of a tangle trying to defend
excellent line outside off, Kallis defends solidly into the covers
comes half forward and drives up to mid-off
tempting for Kallis, short and wide from Broad but Kallis misses out as he throws the kitchen sink at a cut shot...almost a third catch for Prior
fuller on middle and off, punched back to Broad who then flicks the ball back to the wicketkeeper
gone! Broad is on fire, and England are catching everything...touch of width outside off and Kallis flashes hard, the edge flying to Shah at first slip, taking it nonchalantly to his right
on off stump, defended with bat and pad together back down the pitch
outside off, still some movement for Anderson, de Villiers leaves alone
that's a beauty outside off, short of a length, drawing de Villiers into a flat-footed push...almost gets an edge
full and wide outside off, de Villiers leans into a flashing dive which flies just wide of Collingwood at backward point...he was at full stretch but couldn't quite haul it in
another edge, this time from Duminy, but it falls short of the slips and splits the gap between Shah and Flintoff
that's a top shot, a perfect cover drive as Anderson offers a hint of wide and it was a touch full as well...rifles it wide of mid-off to release some of the pressure
worked into the leg side, between midwicket and mid-on

and another, four for Broad! Perfect line and length outside off, an indeterminant poke from Duminy and a thin outside edge goes through to Prior, for his third catch...late movement away from the left hander, superb spell from Broad
beaten first ball, full on off stump, draws Boucher into a loose drive and it wasn't far away from the outside edge
turned off the stumps to Patel at midwicket
defended from off stump, into the leg side
square up in defence, takes a leading edge as he tries to turn it to leg...rolls into the off side
immediately he passes the outside edge, gaining a touch of bounce and movement away from the right hander. Flintoff gives de Villiers a glare
left alone
a rare stray down the leg-side - and a wide, the first of the innings
touch too wide...that could easily have been "called" by the umpire, but Flintoff gets away with it
back of a length and defended on the back foot
wide of the off stump, left alone once more
excellent delivery, cutting back into de Villiers who shouldered arms, and that wasn't far away from his off stump
ooh that's cut back nastily on Boucher who gets a leading edge out to cover, but it falls safely
what a cracker! Lift, bounce, movement - it snapped away from Boucher at the last moment. Good pace, too
a touch wider this time and Boucher can leave this alone more comfortably
good line on the off stump, forcing Boucher forward this time. Firmly defended
onto the front foot and defended, though the ball bobbles backwards indicating he was a little late on it
blocked out on the back foot

my word that's close, Flintoff's rapped him on the pads and Taufel gives it a long, hard look, but it's perhaps just shaping down the leg side. A very good shout though, and encouraging movement off the pitch for Flintoff
clipped smartly through midwicket, and Broad makes a good diving save on the boundary edge
down the leg side, and nudged behind square - Broad, again, has to run around and he makes another good save
another off-cutter but it hurries de Villiers into a nudgy poke to leg
firmly defended on the front foot
another off-cutter that hurries him into a defensive poke to leg
turned to leg with a neat flick
nudged out to the offside
squared up a touch out to the off side
left alone outside off
extraordinary shot really. He wanted to try and turn it to leg but it straightened on him at the last moment
terrific line on a nagging length, but he can leave this alone
good, straight delivery middle-and-leg which he nudges to leg
squeezed out on the front foot
very good line just outside the off stump. Boucher's cautious in defence
flicked down to fine leg for a single. Broad does the fielding and fires in a rocket throw which nearly decapitates de Villiers
got him! A fuller delivery that cuts back sharply on de Villiers, hurrying him, and he's rapped on the pads. Taufel raises his finger, and South Africa are in a sorry state here
spearing into his legs, and defended
a good line outside off, squared up a touch
nervous stroke off the back foot, shuffling back and inside-edging it past his stumps
very good line @ 85.7mph, but Botha defending on the front foot
dabbed down to the off side
firmly blocked off the back foot - excellent length by Broad
fast and spearing into his legs
a nasty, awkward lifter outside off! That's very nearly unplayable
that's kept low this time! An off-cutter that jagged back with doom and only just missed his off stump
beaten for pace and he top-edges this over the slips for four. Another seriously quick ball heading for Boucher's helmet, and he did well to get something on it at all
got him this time! A touch fuller, Boucher is stuck on the back foot and edges it behind
good line outside off and left alone
he steps nervously to leg to defend this on the back foot
good length just outside the off stump. It's defended with a roar of "no" by the right-hander
defended on the back foot, angled down to gully
defended on the back foot this time
a little too wide from Broad, and it's comfortably left alone
again it's a bit too wide and he can leave it well alone
he shuffles across to the off side to defend
it's a wide - on height. A quick bouncer but a bit too short
cut down to third man
a bit too straight and it's left alone down the leg side
nasty, quick delivery outside the off stump
shorter ball that Botha fends off his chest, just to the right of Samit Patel at leg-gully
it's left alone
short of a length, Morkel is back and defending
angled down off the back foot to gully
and there's his fifth! A poor shot from Botha, driving flashily outside his off stump - but again it's well bowled, cutting it back into the right-hander
Nel's whacked him for four! On the up, on the back foot, and he times it beautifully
picked up over mid-on and it's four more! A flurry here, denting Broad's miserly figures
defended on the back foot
clunked down the ground for four more! That's dented his figures somewhat
round the wicket, beaten as he pushes off the back foot
driven square off the back foot to Collingwood at backward point
beaten again by extra bounce from round the wicket, angling into Morkel who is cramped for room as he tries to cut
carved away squad wide of backward point, straight down to Harmison at third man
bouncer, very short over leg stump and called wide by Simon Taufel
that's too quick for Nel, banged in short at the body, Nel goes for an ugly heave but doesn't get near it
goes full at the stumps, squeezed out past Samit Patel at short leg
gone! strikes first ball, Nel goes for a huge heave over the leg side and only succeeds in sending it miles up in the air. Luke Wright steadies himself from mid-on to take the catch
goes for a cut, doesn't make contact as the bounce takes it over the top edge through to Prior
cramping him for room on middle and leg, defended into the off side
swung away hard through the leg side, wide of mid-on, just an uncomplicated swing from Morkel, that's what he needs to do now
and another bites the dust! Morkel plays a weak cut outside off and sends a simple edge low to Matt Prior, six in the innings for him now, great effort
goes full and straight first up, big inside edge into the pads otherwise that was out as well
just gets a little carried away there, banged in very short and very quick, flies over everyone including Prior, away for five wides
backs away to leg, beats the drive and scoots past leg stump
defiance from Steyn, driven away square through the off side and runs away through point
Steyn comes down the pitch, Flintoff bangs it in short and it goes over his head
squirted away down to fine leg off the inside edge
goes for a huge swing over the leg side, doesn't make contact, Steyn isn't going to hang around here
full, straight and all over. Flintoff gets a delivery on target as Steyn misses a drive and Flintoff takes his third.

inn2.comm: on off stump, Bell makes his customary stride towards the ball and defends to mid-on
down the leg side, takes the pad and runs away down to the fine-leg boundary...England are away
flicked off the stumps, nice timing from Bell through midwicket and now he's off the mark
back on off stump, defended into the ground by his feet
good bounce outside off stump, pushes firmly into the covers
flicked from off stump, straight to mid-on
full outside off, driven away past mid-off and not quite perfectly timed, Johan Botha drags it back inside the ropes
driven between cover and mid-off, off a thick outside half of the bat so it just dribbles for a single
defended firmly into the covers, confident stride from Prior to meet the ball
bowled from wide on the crease, angled back into Prior who is doubled up as he strikes him in the midriff and bobbles behind to the slips
expansive drive, gets an inside edge into the pads
comes back again at Prior, good over from Ntini, still movement for the quick bowlers
full on off stump, defended into the covers
sweetly driven off the front foot, straight at mid-off
defended firmly with a straight bat, good line from Steyn
well bowled, jags back between Bell's half-hearted drive, beats the inside edge and goes low to Boucher
goes for the pull, but doesn't time it at all and nearly lobs it to mid-on, no timing in that as he played too early
defended very correctly down to mid-on, tidy over from Steyn, but South Africa need quick wickets and plenty of them
down the pitch from Prior, driven from outside off through mid-on, he took a couple of skips down the track and played a quality shot
defended into the leg side, down to mid-on
keeps Prior in defence, pushed to mid-off
pushed into the gap at midwicket, a well-judged quick single
good length outside off, pushed firmly into the off side as Bell remains very correct
tucked from outside off into midwicket again, simply done from Bell and six runs from the over
effortless back-foot drive from Bell, on his toes and pushed through the covers for an elegant boundary
good reply from Steyn, sharp bouncer at Bell who goes for a pull but isn't anywhere near it
defended from off side into the covers...Bell seems very at easy currently, but they her always does
plays away from his body, gets a bottom edge past the stumps away to fine leg
well, well...Prior backs way outside leg and drives to launch Steyn over extra cover...doesn't make contact and is almost bowled
jags back at Prior, takes the thigh pad and falls very close to the stumps. Heart in mouth moment for Prior, but he's still there
Bell is back and across, punching this without major intent out to cover
Bell drops it to leg
ooh dear, that's got him between the knee-roll...so to speak. A big incutter
wider of the crease from Ntini and Bell tries to whip this off his hip but it bounces more than expected
wider of the off stump and left alone
beaten by a beauty that holds its line on Bell who fishes and misses. Terrific ball
oh, shot. A clumpy, forcing shot off the back foot square of the wicket - nothing more than a defensive drop, but he times it brilliantly over AB de Villiers' head at point
on his legs and tucked for a single
back and across by Bell who defends
that was mighty quick, but wild and woolly down the leg side. And it's a no-ball, too
clunked inside out and straight into the hands of Botha at mid-off
Prior steps outside leg, and Steyn follows him, but Prior simply walks into a pull over midwicket - excellent stroke and he got plenty of bat on it
a crunching back-foot drive! But brilliantly stopped by Gibbs at extra cover to save four. He hit that with monstrous power
outside off, Bell flicks to leg and they scamper a single
whallop. Prior's down the pitch and clobbering this miles in the air, over the bowler's head, and it lands just over the boundary for the first six of the match
on the back foot and it's defended
driven down the ground
solidly behind the line and defending
fine delivery beating Bell outside his off stump. Just enough movement there
down the leg side at 93mph and it's another wide
down the leg side again and it's another wide
steps outside leg but top-edges it down to third man - and just short of the fielder. Good intent by the batsman, though. Might as well throw your bat in such circumstances
clunked out to the off side
and again it's miles down the leg side
again fired down the leg side, which would've been a wide had it not been a no-ball. Boucher appealed, but it was off his pad
he's under it, he's clobbering it - is it six over midwicket? No, caught by the man on the boundary, but at least he gets a single
firmly defended on the front foot
dabbed down to point and Bell at last gets a single
on the pull and he top-edges it, but short of deep midwicket
oh he's timed that beautifully, on-driving it but Nel pulls off a fine save at mid-on
turned around the corner
excellent ball, hurrying Prior into a backward defensive off his chest. But he plays this nicely, dropping it to leg for a single
dabbed down to the point region
now that is a fine shot, whipping this from outside the off stump through (over, in fact) short midwicket for four. Class and power
defended on the back foot
defended on the back foot
clattered off the back foot just short of Gibbs at short extra cover
a wild swing and a miss to one which bent away from the right-hander at the last moment
power! That's a fine, fine shot from Prior, driving this straight back down the ground for four. Immense timing
defended cautiously on the front foot
squared up - good end to the over
down the leg side and again it's a wide
clunked on the back foot for four! Beautiful timing by Bell, absolutely clobbered it
dropped down to the off side
firmly defended on the front foot
again firmly defended - good line just outside off
blocked off the back foot
beautiful shot, stroking this off the back foot for a juicy and classy four
defended on the back foot
spanked. Utterly spanked off the back foot with disdain and he holds the pose
turned to leg for a quick single
wide of the off stump and left alone
defended cautiously off the back foot
prodded to mid-off for a single
behind the line and Bell defends
turned to leg for a quick single
short and wellied just over short midwicket - and this too falls short of the fielder! Well, when it's going your way...
defended once more from Bell
flicked from outside off through midwicket
too straight and they run a leg-bye
short of a length and pulled over midwicket for four to complete the most savage of thumpings
